Clipping Svg

HTML

                  
                    <svg class="svg-defs">
  <defs>
    <clipPath id="jag-left">
      <polygon points="8 0, 150 0, 150 150, 8 150, 0 135, 8 120, 0 105, 8 90, 0 75, 8 60, 0 45, 8 30, 0 15"></polygon>
    </clipPath>
    <clipPath id="jag-right">
      <polygon id="poly-right" points="0 0, 150 0, 142 15, 150 30, 142 45, 150 60, 142 75, 150 90, 142 105, 150 120, 142 135, 150 150, 0 150"></polygon>
    </clipPath>
    <clipPath id="jag-both">
      <polygon points="8 0, 150 0, 142 15, 150 30, 142 45, 150 60, 142 75, 150 90, 142 105, 150 120, 142 135, 150 150, 8 150, 0 135, 8 120, 0 105, 8 90, 0 75, 8 60, 0 45, 8 30, 0 15"></polygon>
    </clipPath>
  </defs>
</svg>

Icons

Icons available

icon--close
icon--menu
icon--search

How to use icons

In HTML

Add the class: `icon--name-of-icon` like this: `icon--arrow-down`. So 

<i class="icon--search">Search</i>
becomes Search

In Sass, as a psuedo selector

Use the mixin `icon` with the argument of the icon name like this: `@include icon(facebook);`. So

HTML

<div class="demo-random-icon">Random icon here</div>

CSS

.demo-random-icon {
    @include icon(facebook);
}

becomes

Random icon here.

In Sass, as a text-replacement

This may be more familiar for those coming from image sprites. Use the mixin `icon` with the argument of the icon name plus "$text-replace: true" as an argument: `@include icon(twitter, $text-replace: true);`. So

HTML

<div class="demo-text-replace-icon">This text will be gone</div>

CSS

.demo-text-replace-icon {
  @include icon('twitter', $text-replace: true);
  height: 16px;
  width: 16px;
}
becomes
This text will be gone

You're responsible for height, width, positioning, etc.

Adding and generating icons

SVG files added to `source/images/icons/src/` while running `grunt` are automatically added to the font face. To manually compile icon fonts, run `grunt icons-build`.

Files of note

  1. images/icons/icon-font-template.ai: 512px x 512px Adobe Illustrator template that each font should fit within. Export as SVG from this template at full 512px size.
  2. scss/00-config/_icons.scss: Defines variables used for icons
  3. scss/10-base/_icons-base.scss: Defines mixins used
  4. scss/30-global/_icons-application: Generates the starting CSS styles for default .icon--something elements
Generated by gulp-iconfont.

HTML

                  
                    <div class="icons-container">

  <h3>Icons available</h3>

  <div class="icons-demo" id="icons">
    
    <div class="icons__item" data-name="close">
      <i class="icon--close"></i> icon--close 
    </div>
    
    <div class="icons__item" data-name="menu">
      <i class="icon--menu"></i> icon--menu 
    </div>
    
    <div class="icons__item" data-name="search">
      <i class="icon--search"></i> icon--search 
    </div>
    
  </div>

  <h3>How to use icons</h3>

  <p><strong>In HTML</strong></p>

  <p>Add the class: `icon--name-of-icon` like this: `icon--arrow-down`. So
  <pre>&#x3C;i class=&#x22;icon--search&#x22;&#x3E;Search&#x3C;/i&#x3E;</pre>
  becomes <i class="icon--search">Search</i></p>

  <p><strong>In Sass, as a psuedo selector</strong></p>

  <p>Use the mixin `icon` with the argument of the icon name like this: `@include icon(facebook);`. So</p>
  <p>HTML</p>
  <pre>&#x3C;div class=&#x22;demo-random-icon&#x22;&#x3E;Random icon here&#x3C;/div&#x3E;</pre>
  <p>CSS</p>
  <pre>.demo-random-icon {
    @include icon(facebook);
}</pre>
  <p>becomes</p>
  <div class="demo-random-icon">Random icon here.</div>

  <p><strong>In Sass, as a text-replacement</strong></p>

  <p>This may be more familiar for those coming from image sprites. Use the mixin `icon` with the argument of the icon name plus "$text-replace: true" as an argument: `@include icon(twitter, $text-replace: true);`. So</p>
  <p>HTML</p>
  <pre>&#x3C;div class=&#x22;demo-text-replace-icon&#x22;&#x3E;This text will be gone&#x3C;/div&#x3E;</pre>
  <p>CSS</p>
  <pre>.demo-text-replace-icon {
  @include icon('twitter', $text-replace: true);
  height: 16px;
  width: 16px;
}</pre>
  becomes
  <div class="demo-text-replace-icon">This text will be gone</div>
  <p>You're responsible for height, width, positioning, etc.</p>

  <p><strong>Adding and generating icons</strong></p>

  <p>SVG files added to `source/images/icons/src/` while running `grunt` are automatically added to the font face. To manually compile icon fonts, run `grunt icons-build`.</p>

  <p><strong>Files of note</strong></p>
  <ol>
    <li>images/icons/icon-font-template.ai: 512px x 512px Adobe Illustrator template that each font should fit within. Export as SVG from this template at full 512px size.</li>
    <li>scss/00-config/_icons.scss: Defines variables used for icons</li>
    <li>scss/10-base/_icons-base.scss: Defines mixins used</li>
    <li>scss/30-global/_icons-application: Generates the starting CSS styles for default .icon--something elements</li>
  </ol>

  <footer class="icons-demo__footer">Generated by
    <a href="https://github.com/nfroidure/gulp-iconfont">gulp-iconfont</a>.
  </footer>

</div>
